Parameters.Description: The number whose absolute value is to be returned.
Parameters.Name: Number

ACOS.Description: Returns the arccosine of a number.

Parameters.Description: A value between -1 and 1 for which the arccosine is to be returned.
Parameters.Name: Number

ACOSH.Description: Returns the inverse hyperbolic cosine of a number.

Parameters.Description: A value greater than or equal to 1 for which the hyperbolic cosine is to be returned.
Parameters.Name: Number

ACOT.Description: Returns the inverse cotangent of a number.

Parameters.Description: The value for which the inverse cotangent is to be returned.
Parameters.Name: Number

ACOTH.Description: Returns the inverse hyperbolic cotangent of a number.

Parameters.Description: A value smaller than -1 or greater than 1 for which the inverse hyperbolic cotangent is to be returned.
Parameters.Name: Number

ADDRESS.Description: Returns the reference to a cell as text.

Parameters.Description: The row number of the cell.
Parameters.Name: row

Parameters.Description: The column number of the cell.
Parameters.Name: column

Parameters.Description: Specifies whether absolute or relative referencing is to be used.
Parameters.Name: ABS

Parameters.Description: The reference style: 0 or FALSE means R1C1 style, any other value or omitted means A1 style.
Parameters.Name: A1

Parameters.Description: The spreadsheet name of the cell reference.
Parameters.Name: sheet

AND.Description: Returns TRUE if all arguments are TRUE.

Parameters.Description: Logical value 1, logical value 2;...are 1 to 30 conditions to be tested and each returns either TRUE or FALSE.
Parameters.Name: Logical value

ARABIC.Description: Calculates the value of a Roman numeral.

Parameters.Description: The text that represents a Roman numeral.
Parameters.Name: Text

AREAS.Description: Returns the number of individual ranges that belong to a (multiple) range.

Parameters.Description: The reference to a (multiple) range.
Parameters.Name: reference

ASC.Description: Converts full-width ASCII and katakana characters to half-width.

Parameters.Description: The text to convert.
Parameters.Name: text

ASIN.Description: Returns the arcsine of a number.

Parameters.Description: A value between -1 and 1 for which the arcsine is to be returned.
Parameters.Name: Number

ASINH.Description: Returns the inverse hyperbolic sine of a number.

Parameters.Description: The value for which the inverse hyperbolic sine is to be returned.
Parameters.Name: Number

ATAN.Description: Returns the arctangent of a number.

Parameters.Description: The value for which the arctangent is to be returned.
Parameters.Name: Number

ATAN2.Description: Returns the arctangent for the specified coordinates.

Parameters.Description: The value for the x coordinate.
Parameters.Name: number_x

Parameters.Description: The value for the y coordinate.
Parameters.Name: number_y

ATANH.Description: Returns the inverse hyperbolic tangent of a number.

Parameters.Description: A value between -1 and 1 for which the inverse hyperbolic tangent is to be returned.
Parameters.Name: Number

AVEDEV.Description: Returns the average of the absolute deviations of a sample from the mean.

Parameters.Description: Number 1, number 2;...are 1 to 30 numerical arguments representing a sample.
Parameters.Name: number

AVERAGE.Description: Returns the average of a sample.

Parameters.Description: Number 1, number 2;...are 1 to 30 numeric arguments representing a population sample.
Parameters.Name: number

AVERAGEA.Description: Returns the average value for a sample. Text is evaluated as zero.

Parameters.Description: Value 1; value 2; ... are 1 to 30 arguments representing a sample taken from a basic total population.
Parameters.Name: value

AVERAGEIF.Description: Averages the arguments that meet the conditions.

Parameters.Description: The range to be evaluated by the criteria given.
Parameters.Name: range

Parameters.Description: The range from which the values are to be averaged.

AVERAGEIFS.Description: Averages the value of the cells that meet multiple criteria in multiple ranges.

Parameters.Description: Range 1, range 2,... are the ranges to be evaluated by the criteria given.
Parameters.Name: range

Parameters.Description: Criteria 1, criteria 2,... are the cell ranges in which the search criteria are given.
Parameters.Name: criteria

Parameters.Name: number

Parameters.Description: The value for which the beta distribution is to be calculated.

Parameters.Description: The Alpha parameter of the Beta distribution.
Parameters.Name: alpha

Parameters.Description: Cumulated. C=0 calculates the individual probability, C=1 the cumulated probability.

BITAND.Description: Returns the bitwise AND of two integers

Parameters.Description: Positive integer less than 2^48.
Parameters.Name: Number1

Parameters.Description: Positive integer less than 2^48.
Parameters.Name: Number2

BITLSHIFT.Description: Bitwise left shift of an integer value.

Parameters.Description: The value to be shifted. Positive integer.
Parameters.Name: Number

Parameters.Description: The number of bits the first argument is to be shifted by.
Parameters.Name: Shift

BITOR.Description: Returns the bitwise OR of two integers

Parameters.Description: Positive integer less than 2^48.
Parameters.Name: Number1

Parameters.Description: Positive integer less than 2^48.
Parameters.Name: Number2

BITRSHIFT.Description: Bitwise right shift of an integer value.

Parameters.Description: The value to be shifted. Positive integer.
Parameters.Name: Number

Parameters.Description: The number of bits the first argument is to be shifted by.
Parameters.Name: Shift

BITXOR.Description: Returns the bitwise XOR of two integers

Parameters.Description: Positive integer less than 2^48.
Parameters.Name: Number1

Parameters.Description: Positive integer less than 2^48.
Parameters.Name: Number2

CEILING.Description: Rounds a number up to the nearest multiple of significance.

Parameters.Description: The number to be rounded up.
Parameters.Name: Number

Parameters.Description: The number to whose multiple the value is rounded.
Parameters.Name: Significance

Parameters.Description: If given and not equal to zero then rounded up according to amount when a negative number and significance.
Parameters.Name: Mode

CELL.Description: Determines information about address, formatting or contents of a cell.

Parameters.Description: String that specifies the type of information.
Parameters.Name: info_type

Parameters.Description: The position of the cell you want to examine.
Parameters.Name: Reference

CHAR.Description: Converts a code number into a character or letter.

Parameters.Description: The code value for the character.
Parameters.Name: number

CHISQDIST.Description: Returns left-tail probability of the cumulative distribution function or values of the probability density function of the chi-square distribution.

Parameters.Description: The value for which the probability density function or cumulative distribution function is to be calculated.
Parameters.Name: Number

Parameters.Description: The degrees of freedom of the chi-square distribution.
Parameters.Name: Degrees of Freedom

Parameters.Description: 0 or FALSE calculates the probability density function. Any other value or TRUE or omitted calculates the cumulative distribution function.
Parameters.Name: Cumulative

CHISQINV.Description: Values of the inverse of CHISQDIST(x;DegreesOfFreedom;TRUE()).

Parameters.Description: The probability value for which the inverse of the chi square distribution is to be calculated.
Parameters.Name: Probability

Parameters.Description: The degrees of freedom of the chi square distribution.
Parameters.Name: Degrees of Freedom

CHOOSE.Description: Selects a value from a list of up to 30 value arguments.

Parameters.Description: The index of the value (1..30) selected.
Parameters.Name: Index

Parameters.Description: Value 1, value 2,... The list of arguments from which a value is chosen.
Parameters.Name: value

CLEAN.Description: Removes all nonprintable characters from text.

Parameters.Description: The text from which nonprintable characters are to be removed.
Parameters.Name: text

CODE.Description: Returns a numeric code for the first character in a text string.

Parameters.Description: This is the text for which the code of the first character is to be found.
Parameters.Name: text

COLUMN.Description: Returns the internal column number of a reference.

COLUMNS.Description: Returns the number of columns in an array or reference.

COMBIN.Description: Calculates the number of combinations for elements without repetition.

Parameters.Name: number_2

COMBINA.Description: Calculates the number of combinations of elements including repetition.

Parameters.Name: number_1

Parameters.Description: The number of elements selected.
Parameters.Name: number_2

CONCATENATE.Description: Combines several text items into one.

Parameters.Description: Text for the concatenation.
Parameters.Name: text

CONFIDENCE.Description: Returns a (1 alpha) confidence interval for a normal distribution.

COS.Description: Returns the cosine of a number.

Parameters.Name: Number

COSH.Description: Returns the hyperbolic cosine of a number.

Parameters.Description: The value for which the hyperbolic cosine is to be returned.
Parameters.Name: Number

COT.Description: Returns the cotangent of a number.

Parameters.Description: The angle in radians whose cotangent value is to be returned.

COTH.Description: Returns the hyperbolic cotangent of a number.

Parameters.Description: A value not equal to 0 for which the hyperbolic cotangent is to be returned.
Parameters.Name: Number

COUNT.Description: Counts how many numbers are in the list of arguments.

Parameters.Description: Value 1, value 2, ... are 1 to 30 arguments containing different data types but where only numbers are counted.
Parameters.Name: value

COUNTA.Description: Counts how many values are in the list of arguments.

Parameters.Description: Value 1, value 2, ... are 1 to 30 arguments representing the values to be counted.

COUNTBLANK.Description: Counts the blank cells in a specified range.

Parameters.Description: The range in which empty cells are to be counted.
Parameters.Name: range

COUNTIF.Description: Counts the arguments which meet the set conditions.

Parameters.Name: alpha

CSC.Description: Return the cosecant of an angle. CSC(x)=1/SIN(x)

Parameters.Description: The angle in radians for which the cosecant is to be calculated.
Parameters.Name: Angle

CSCH.Description: Return the hyperbolic cosecant of a hyperbolic angle. CSCH(x)=1/SINH(x)

Parameters.Description: The hyperbolic angle in radians for which the hyperbolic cosecant is to be calculated.
Parameters.Name: Angle

CUMIPMT.Description: Cumulative compounded interest. Calculates the total amount of the interest share in a period for an investment with a constant interest rate.

Parameters.Description: The rate of interest per period.
Parameters.Name: Rate

Parameters.Description: Payment period. The total number of periods in which the annuity (pension) is paid.
Parameters.Name: NPER

Parameters.Description: The present value. The present value or the amount the annuity is currently worth.
Parameters.Name: pv

Parameters.Description: The start period. The first period to be taken into account. A = 1 denotes the very first period.
Parameters.Name: S

Parameters.Description: The end period. The last period to be taken into account.
Parameters.Name: E

Parameters.Description: Type = 1 denotes due at the beginning of the period, = 0 at the end.
Parameters.Name: Type

CUMPRINC.Description: Cumulative Capital. Calculates the total amount of the repayment share in a period for an investment with constant interest rate.

Parameters.Description: The rate of interest per period.
Parameters.Name: Rate

Parameters.Description: Payment period. The total number of periods in which the annuity (pension) is paid.
Parameters.Name: NPER

Parameters.Description: The present value. The present value or the amount the annuity is currently worth.
Parameters.Name: PV

Parameters.Description: The start period. The first period to be taken into account. A = 1 denotes the very first period.
Parameters.Name: S

Parameters.Description: End period. The last period to be taken into account.
Parameters.Name: E

Parameters.Description: Type = 1 denotes due at the beginning of the period, = 0 at the end.
Parameters.Name: Type

DATE.Description: Provides an internal number for the date given.

Parameters.Description: An integer between 1583 and 9956 or 0 and 99 (19xx or 20xx depending on the defined option).

DAYS.Description: Calculates the number of days between two dates.

Parameters.Description: Method used to form differences: Type = 0 denotes US method (NASD), Type = 1 denotes the European method.

DB.Description: Returns the real depreciation of an asset for a specified period using the fixed-declining balance method.

Parameters.Description: Acquisition costs: The initial cost of the asset.
Parameters.Name: Cost

Parameters.Description: Salvage: The remaining value of the asset at the end of its life.
Parameters.Name: Salvage

Parameters.Description: Useful life. The number of periods in the useful life of the asset.

Parameters.Description: Periods: The period for which the depreciation is calculated. The time unit used for period must be the same as that for the useful life.
Parameters.Name: Period

Parameters.Description: Months: The number of months in the first year of depreciation.
Parameters.Name: month

DDB.Description: Calculates the depreciation of an asset for a specific period using the double-declining balance method or declining balance factor.

Parameters.Description: Acquisition costs. The initial cost of the asset.
Parameters.Name: Cost

Parameters.Description: Salvage: The remaining value of the asset at the end of its life.
Parameters.Name: Salvage

Parameters.Description: Useful life. The number of periods in the useful life of the asset.
Parameters.Name: Life

Parameters.Description: Period. The depreciation period in the same time unit as the average useful life entry.
Parameters.Name: Period

Parameters.Description: Factor. The factor for balance decline. F = 2 means a double declining balance factor
Parameters.Name: Factor

Parameters.Description: The name of the server application.

Parameters.Description: The more this value increases, the more the Roman numeral is simplified. The value must be in the 0 - 4 range.

ROUND.Description: Rounds a number to a predefined accuracy.

Parameters.Description: The number to be rounded.
Parameters.Name: number

Parameters.Description: The number of places to which a number is to be rounded.
Parameters.Name: count

ROUNDDOWN.Description: Rounds a number down to a predefined accuracy.

Parameters.Description: The number to be rounded down.
Parameters.Name: number

Parameters.Description: The number of places down to which a number is to be rounded.
Parameters.Name: count

ROUNDUP.Description: Rounds a number up to the predefined accuracy.

Parameters.Description: The number to be rounded up.
Parameters.Name: number

Parameters.Description: The number of places to which a number is to be rounded.
Parameters.Name: count

ROW.Description: Defines the internal row number of a reference.

Parameters.Description: The reference to a cell or a range.
Parameters.Name: reference

ROWS.Description: Returns the number of rows in a reference or array.

Parameters.Description: The array (reference) for which the number of rows is to be determined.
Parameters.Name: array

RSQ.Description: Returns the square of the Pearson product moment correlation coefficient.

Parameters.Description: The Y data array.
Parameters.Name: data_Y

Parameters.Description: The X data array.
Parameters.Name: data_X

SEARCH.Description: Looks for one text value within another (not case-sensitive).

Parameters.Description: The text to be found.
Parameters.Name: find_text

Parameters.Description: The text in which a search is to be made.
Parameters.Name: text

Parameters.Description: The position in the text where the search is started.
Parameters.Name: position

SEC.Description: Return the secant of an angle. SEC(x)=1/COS(x)

Parameters.Description: The angle in radians for which the secant is to be calculated.
Parameters.Name: Angle

SECH.Description: Return the hyperbolic secant of a hyperbolic angle. SECH(x)=1/COSH(x)

Parameters.Description: The hyperbolic angle in radians for which the hyperbolic secant is to be calculated.
Parameters.Name: Angle

SECOND.Description: Determines the sequential number of the second of a minute (0-59) for the time value.

Parameters.Description: The internal time value.
Parameters.Name: Number

SHEET.Description: Returns the internal sheet number of a reference or a string.

Parameters.Description: The reference to a cell or a range or the character string of a sheet name.
Parameters.Name: reference

SHEETS.Description: Returns the number of sheets of a given reference. If no parameter has been entered, the total number of sheets in the document is returned.

Parameters.Description: The reference to a cell or a range.
Parameters.Name: reference

SIGN.Description: Returns the algebraic sign of a number.

Parameters.Description: The number for which the algebraic sign is to be determined.
Parameters.Name: Number

SIN.Description: Returns the sine of a number.

Parameters.Description: The angle in radians for which the sine is to be calculated.
Parameters.Name: number

SINH.Description: Returns the hyperbolic sine of a number.

Parameters.Description: The value for which the hyperbolic sine is to be calculated.
Parameters.Name: number

SKEW.Description: Returns the skewness of a distribution.

Parameters.Description: Number 1, number 2, ... are 1 to 30 numerical arguments portraying a sample of the distribution.
Parameters.Name: number

SLN.Description: Calculates the linear depreciation per period.

Parameters.Description: Acquisition cost. The initial cost of an asset.
Parameters.Name: Cost

Parameters.Description: Salvage: The remaining value of the asset at the end of its life.
Parameters.Name: Salvage

Parameters.Description: Useful life. The number of periods in the useful life of the asset.
Parameters.Name: Life

SLOPE.Description: Returns the slope of the linear regression line.

Parameters.Description: The Y data array.
Parameters.Name: data_Y

Parameters.Description: The X data array.
Parameters.Name: data_X

SMALL.Description: Returns the k-th smallest value of a sample.

Parameters.Description: The array of the data in the sample.
Parameters.Name: data

Parameters.Description: The ranking of the value.
Parameters.Name: Rank_c

SQRT.Description: Returns the square root of a number.

Parameters.Description: A positive value for which the square root is to be calculated.
Parameters.Name: number

STANDARDIZE.Description: Converts a random variable to a normalized value.

Parameters.Description: The value to be standardized.
Parameters.Name: Number

Parameters.Description: The mean value used for moving.
Parameters.Name: mean

Parameters.Description: The standard deviation used for scaling.
Parameters.Name: STDEV

STDEV.Description: Calculates the standard deviation based on a sample.

Parameters.Description: Number 1, number 2, ... are 1 to 30 numerical arguments which portray a sample of a population.
Parameters.Name: number

STDEVA.Description: Returns the standard deviation based on a sample. Text is evaluated as zero.

Parameters.Description: Value 1; value 2; ... are 1 to 30 arguments representing a sample taken from a basic total population.
Parameters.Name: value

STDEVP.Description: Calculates the standard deviation based on the entire population.

Parameters.Description: Number 1, number 2, ... are 1 to 30 numerical arguments which portray a sample of a population.
Parameters.Name: number

STDEVPA.Description: Returns the standard deviation based on the entire population. Text is evaluated as zero.

Parameters.Description: Value 1; value 2;... are 1 to 30 arguments corresponding to a population.
Parameters.Name: value

STEYX.Description: Returns the standard error of the linear regression.

Parameters.Description: The Y data array.
Parameters.Name: data_Y

Parameters.Description: The X data array.
Parameters.Name: data_X

SUBSTITUTE.Description: Substitutes new text for old text in a string.

Parameters.Description: The text in which partial words are to be replaced.
Parameters.Name: text

Parameters.Description: The partial string to be (repeatedly) replaced.
Parameters.Name: search_text

Parameters.Description: The text which is to replace the text string.
Parameters.Name: new text

Parameters.Description: Which occurrence of the old text is to be replaced.
Parameters.Name: occurrence

Parameters.Description: Function index. Is an index of the possible functions Total, Max, ...
Parameters.Name: Function

Parameters.Description: The cells of the range which are to be taken into account.
Parameters.Name: range

SUM.Description: Returns the sum of all arguments.

Parameters.Description: Number 1, number 2, ... are 1 to 30 arguments whose total is to be calculated.
Parameters.Name: number

SUMIF.Description: Totals the arguments that meet the conditions.

Parameters.Description: The range to be evaluated by the criteria given.
Parameters.Name: range

Parameters.Description: The cell range in which the search criteria are given.
Parameters.Name: criteria

Parameters.Description: The range from which the values are to be totalled.
Parameters.Name: sum_range

SUMIFS.Description: Totals the values of cells in a range that meet multiple criteria in multiple ranges.

Parameters.Description: The range from which the values are to be totalled.
Parameters.Name: sum_range

Parameters.Description: Range 1, range 2,... are the ranges to be evaluated by the criteria given.
Parameters.Name: range

Parameters.Description: Criteria 1, criteria 2,... are the cell ranges in which the search criteria are given.
Parameters.Name: criteria

SUMPRODUCT.Description: (Inner products) Returns the sum of the products of array arguments.

Parameters.Description: Array 1, array 2, ... are up to 30 arrays whose arguments are to be multiplied.
Parameters.Name: Array

SUMSQ.Description: Returns the sum of the squares of the arguments.

Parameters.Description: Number 1, number 2,... are 1 to 30 arguments for which the sum of the squares is to be calculated.
Parameters.Name: number

SUMX2MY2.Description: Returns the sum of the difference of squares of two arrays.

Parameters.Description: First array where the square of the arguments are totalled.
Parameters.Name: array_x

Parameters.Description: Second array where the square of the arguments is to be subtracted.
Parameters.Name: array_y

SUMX2PY2.Description: Returns the total of the square sum of two arrays.

Parameters.Description: First array where the square of the arguments are totalled.
Parameters.Name: array_x

Parameters.Description: Second array where the square of the arguments is to be totalled.
Parameters.Name: array_y

SUMXMY2.Description: Returns the sum of squares of differences of two arrays.

Parameters.Description: First array for forming argument differences.
Parameters.Name: array_x

Parameters.Description: Second array for forming the argument differences.
Parameters.Name: array_y

SYD.Description: Calculates the arithmetically declining value of an asset (depreciation) for a specified period.

Parameters.Description: Acquisition costs. The initial cost of the asset.
Parameters.Name: Cost

Parameters.Description: Salvage: The remaining value of the asset at the end of its life.
Parameters.Name: Salvage

Parameters.Description: Useful life. The number of periods in the useful life of the asset.
Parameters.Name: Life

Parameters.Description: Period. The depreciation period which must have the same time unit as average useful life.
Parameters.Name: Period

T.Description: Returns a value if it is text, otherwise an empty string.

Parameters.Description: The value to be checked and returned if it is text.
Parameters.Name: value

TAN.Description: Returns the tangent of a number.

Parameters.Description: The angle in radians for which the tangent is to be calculated.
Parameters.Name: number

TANH.Description: Returns the hyperbolic tangent of a number.

Parameters.Description: The value for which the hyperbolic tangent is to be calculated.
Parameters.Name: number

Parameters.Description: The value for which the T distribution is to be calculated.
Parameters.Name: Number

Parameters.Description: The degrees of freedom of the T distribution.
Parameters.Name: degrees_freedom

Parameters.Description: Mode = 1 calculates the one-tailed test, 2 = two-tailed distribution.
Parameters.Name: mode

TEXT.Description: Converts a number to text according to a given format.

Parameters.Description: The numeric value to be converted.
Parameters.Name: number

Parameters.Description: The text that describes the format.
Parameters.Name: Format

TIME.Description: Determines a time value from the details for hour, minute and second.

Parameters.Description: The integer for the hour.
Parameters.Name: hour

Parameters.Description: The integer for the minute.
Parameters.Name: minute

Parameters.Description: The integer for the second.
Parameters.Name: second

TIMEVALUE.Description: Returns a sequential number for a text shown in a possible time entry format.

Parameters.Description: A text enclosed in quotation marks which returns a time in a %PRODUCTNAME time format.
Parameters.Name: text

Parameters.Description: The probability value for which the inverse T distribution is to be calculated.
Parameters.Name: number

Parameters.Description: The degrees of freedom of the T distribution.
Parameters.Name: degrees_freedom

TODAY.Description: Determines the current date of the computer.

TRANSPOSE.Description: Array transposition. Exchanges the rows and columns of an array.

Parameters.Description: The array in which the rows and columns have been transposed.
Parameters.Name: array

TREND.Description: Calculates points along a regression line.

Parameters.Description: The Y data array.
Parameters.Name: data_Y

Parameters.Description: The X data array as the basis for the regression.
Parameters.Name: data_X

Parameters.Description: The array of X data for recalculating the values.
Parameters.Name: new data_X

Parameters.Description: If type = 0 the linears will be calculated through the zero point, or else moved linears.
Parameters.Name: Linear_type

Parameters.Description: The text in which extra spaces between words are to be deleted.
Parameters.Name: text

TRIMMEAN.Description: Returns the mean of a sample without including the marginal values.

Parameters.Description: The array of the data in the sample.
Parameters.Name: data

Parameters.Description: The percentage of marginal data that is not to be taken into account.
Parameters.Name: Alpha

TRUNC.Description: Truncates the decimal places of a number.

Parameters.Description: The number to be truncated.
Parameters.Name: number

Parameters.Description: The number of places after the decimal point that are not to be truncated.
Parameters.Name: count

Parameters.Description: The first record array.
Parameters.Name: data_1

Parameters.Description: The second record array.
Parameters.Name: data_2

Parameters.Description: Mode specifies the number of distribution tails to return. 1= one-tailed, 2 = two-tailed distribution
Parameters.Name: mode

Parameters.Description: The type of the T test.
Parameters.Name: Type

TYPE.Description: Returns the data type of a value (1 = number, 2 = text, 4 = Boolean value, 8 = formula, 16 = error value, 64 = array).

Parameters.Description: The value for which the data type is to be determined.
Parameters.Name: value

UNICHAR.Description: Converts a code number into a Unicode character or letter.

Parameters.Description: The code value for the character.
Parameters.Name: number

UNICODE.Description: Returns the numeric code for the first Unicode character in a text string.

Parameters.Description: This is the text for which the code of the first character is to be found.
Parameters.Name: text

Parameters.Description: The text in which lower case letters are to be converted to capitals.
Parameters.Name: text

Parameters.Description: The text to be converted to a number.
Parameters.Name: text

VAR.Description: Calculates the variance based on a sample.

Parameters.Description: Number 1, number 2, ... are 1 to 30 numerical arguments which portray a sample of a population.
Parameters.Name: number

VARA.Description: Returns the variance based on a sample. Text is evaluated as zero.

Parameters.Description: Value 1; value 2; ... are 1 to 30 arguments representing a sample taken from a basic total population.
Parameters.Name: value

VARP.Description: Calculates variance based on the entire population.

Parameters.Description: Number 1, number 2, ... are 1 to 30 numerical arguments which represent a population.
Parameters.Name: number

VARPA.Description: Returns the variance based on the entire population. Text is evaluated as zero.

Parameters.Description: Value 1; value 2;... are 1 to 30 arguments representing a population.
Parameters.Name: value

VDB.Description: Variable declining balance. Returns the declining balance depreciation for a particular period.

Parameters.Description: Cost. The initial cost of the asset.
Parameters.Name: Cost

Parameters.Description: Salvage. The salvage value of an asset at the end of its useful life.
Parameters.Name: Salvage

Parameters.Description: Useful life. The number of periods in the useful life of the asset.
Parameters.Name: Life

Parameters.Description: Start. The first period for depreciation in the same time unit as the useful life.
Parameters.Name: S

Parameters.Description: End. The last period of the depreciation using the same time unit as for the useful life.
Parameters.Name: end

Parameters.Description: Factor. The factor for the reduction of the depreciation. F = 2 denotes double rate depreciation.
Parameters.Name: Factor

Parameters.Description: Do not alter. Type = 1 denotes switch to linear depreciation, type = 0 do not switch.
Parameters.Name: Type

VLOOKUP.Description: Vertical search and reference to indicated cells.

Parameters.Description: The value to be found in the first column.
Parameters.Name: Search criterion

Parameters.Description: The array or range for referencing.
Parameters.Name: array

Parameters.Description: Column index number in the array.
Parameters.Name: Index

Parameters.Description: If the value is TRUE or not given, the search column of the array must be sorted in ascending order.
Parameters.Name: sort order

WEEKDAY.Description: Returns the day of the week for the date value as an integer (1-7).

Parameters.Description: The internal number for the date.
Parameters.Name: Number

Parameters.Description: Fixes the beginning of the week and the type of calculation to be used.
Parameters.Name: Type

WEIBULL.Description: Returns the values of the Weibull distribution.

Parameters.Description: The value for which the Weibull distribution is to be calculated.
Parameters.Name: Number

Parameters.Description: The Alpha parameter of the Weibull distribution.
Parameters.Name: Alpha

Parameters.Description: The Beta parameter of the Weibull distribution.
Parameters.Name: beta

Parameters.Description: Cumulated. C=0 calculates the density function, C=1 the distribution.
Parameters.Name: C

XOR.Description: Returns TRUE if exactly one of the arguments is TRUE.

Parameters.Description: Logical value 1, logical value 2,... are 1 to 30 conditions to be tested and which return either TRUE or FALSE.
Parameters.Name: Logical value

YEAR.Description: Returns the year of a date value as an integer.

Parameters.Description: Internal number of the date.
Parameters.Name: Number

ZGZ.Description: Interest. Calculates the interest rate which represents the rate of return from an investment.

Parameters.Description: The number of periods used in the calculation.
Parameters.Name: P

Parameters.Description: Present value. The current value of the investment.
Parameters.Name: pv

Parameters.Description: The future value of the investment.
Parameters.Name: FV

ZTEST.Description: Calculates the probability of observing a z-statistic greater than the one computed based on a sample.

Parameters.Description: The given sample, drawn from a normally distributed population.
Parameters.Name: data

Parameters.Description: The known mean of the population.
Parameters.Name: mu

Parameters.Description: The known standard deviation of the population. If omitted, the standard deviation of the given sample is used.
Parameters.Name: sigma
